text: HIV or human immunodeficiency virus
it was first recognized in the early 80s
in the US but it has its roots in 1920s
Kinshasa a bustling city more than a
million pass through each year thanks to
newly built railways in a thriving sex
trade the virus spreads up the river to
kisaeng Gani to the diamond capital
Abuja mahi and the copper mines of Lubin
Bashi to the US in 1968 before exploding
around the world in the 1980s 78 million
people infected worldwide and Counting
and the spread is far from equal 70%
live in sub-saharan Africa but
antiretroviral drugs offer hope new
infections are down by over a third
mother-to-child transmission has more
than halved and globally there's been a
35 percent decrease in deaths but in the
Middle East and North Africa deaths have
doubled and globally only 37 percent of
those living with HIV have access to
treatment so the challenge now is to
make those life-saving drugs available
to everyone
